turns.content: What would be some great bonuses to include in this course

Great question! Here are some potential bonuses that could be included in this course:

1. Access to a private community: Provide access to a private online community where students can connect with other digital artists, share their work, and get feedback and support from like-minded individuals.
2. Templates and resources: Offer a collection of templates, graphics, and other digital resources that students can use in their own digital art creations. This could include pre-made backgrounds, brushes, fonts, and more.
3. Live Q&A sessions: Schedule live Q&A sessions where students can ask questions and get personalized feedback from the instructor. This is a great way to provide additional support and guidance throughout the course.
4. Guest expert interviews: Bring in guest experts to share their insights and expertise on topics related to digital art creation and selling. This could include successful digital artists, marketing experts, and more.
5. Workbooks and exercises: Provide workbooks and exercises that help students apply the concepts and techniques covered in the course to their own digital art creations. This can help students deepen their understanding and build their skills more effectively.
6. Personalized portfolio review: Offer a personalized portfolio review where students can get feedback and guidance on their digital art creations. This can be a valuable way to identify areas for improvement and get advice on how to take their digital art to the next level.

By including these types of bonuses, you can add value to your course and make it more attractive to potential students. Bonuses also help to deepen the learning experience and provide additional support and guidance to students as they work through the course.

Certainly! Here are 5 more creative bonuses that could be included in this course:

1. Exclusive discounts on digital art tools and supplies: Partner with digital art tool and supply companies to provide exclusive discounts or free trials on their products to course students. This can help students save money and try out new tools and supplies.
2. Monthly challenges and contests: Offer monthly challenges and contests that encourage students to create and share their digital art creations. This can help foster a sense of community and motivation among students, as well as provide opportunities for recognition and prizes.
3. Personalized coaching sessions: Offer personalized coaching sessions where students can get one-on-one feedback and guidance from the instructor on their digital art creations and business strategy.
4. Creative collaboration opportunities: Provide opportunities for students to collaborate on digital art projects or to work together on joint marketing efforts. This can help students build connections and expand their reach in the digital art community.
5. Access to advanced techniques and tutorials: Provide access to advanced techniques and tutorials that go beyond the scope of the main course. This can help students take their digital art skills to the next level and explore new techniques and styles.

These bonuses can add even more value and excitement to your course, and help to differentiate it from other digital art courses on the market. By offering unique and creative bonuses, you can help students feel more engaged and motivated throughout the course, and encourage them to achieve their goals as digital artists and entrepreneurs.
Give me a list of support options that I might incude

Certainly! Here are some support options that you might consider including in your course:

1. Email support: Provide students with an email address or contact form where they can reach out for support and assistance as needed. This is a simple and convenient way to offer support to students throughout the course.
2. Discussion forums: Set up discussion forums where students can ask questions, share their work, and get feedback and support from both the instructor and their fellow students.
3. Live chat support: Offer live chat support during specified hours to answer questions and provide assistance to students in real-time.
4. Personalized coaching sessions: Provide personalized coaching sessions where students can get one-on-one feedback and guidance on their digital art creations and business strategy.
5. Group coaching calls: Schedule group coaching calls where students can get feedback and support from the instructor and other students in a group setting.
6. Resource library: Create a resource library with helpful guides, tutorials, and other resources that students can access at any time throughout the course.
7. Office hours: Set up regular office hours where students can drop in to ask questions and get feedback from the instructor.
8. Peer-to-peer support: Encourage students to connect with each other and offer peer-to-peer support and feedback on their digital art creations.

By offering a variety of support options, you can ensure that students feel well-supported throughout the course and have access to the guidance and assistance they need to achieve their goals.

Certainly! Here are 5 different guarantee options that you might consider offering in your course:

1. 30-day money-back guarantee: Offer a 30-day money-back guarantee to give students peace of mind and encourage them to take action and enroll in the course.
2. Results-based guarantee: Offer a guarantee that promises students specific results, such as increased sales or improved digital art skills. This type of guarantee can help students feel more confident in their decision to enroll in the course.
3. Lifetime access guarantee: Offer a guarantee that promises lifetime access to the course content and any future updates or additions. This can provide students with ongoing value and support even after they complete the course.
4. Satisfaction guarantee: Offer a satisfaction guarantee that promises students they will be satisfied with the course or their money back. This type of guarantee can help students feel more confident in their decision to enroll and more invested in their learning.
5. Performance-based guarantee: Offer a guarantee that promises students that they will achieve a specific level of performance in their digital art skills or online sales. This type of guarantee can help motivate students to take action and complete the course to the best of their ability.

By offering a guarantee, you can help alleviate any concerns or hesitations that potential students may have about enrolling in your course. A guarantee can also help build trust and confidence in your course and increase enrollment and engagement.

Give me 5 different sales page headline formulas that I could use ... then give me 5 examples that would be suitable for this course and customer

Certainly! Here are 5 different sales page headline formulas you could use:

1. The "Big Promise" Headline: This headline formula makes a bold promise about the results or benefits that the reader will get from your course.
2. The "Problem-Solution" Headline: This headline formula addresses a specific problem or pain point that your customer avatar is experiencing, and promises a solution.
3. The "Social Proof" Headline: This headline formula uses social proof to convince the reader that your course is worth taking, such as highlighting testimonials or success stories from previous students.
4. The "Scarcity" Headline: This headline formula creates a sense of urgency by highlighting a limited-time offer or scarcity of spots in the course.
5. The "Contrarian" Headline: This headline formula challenges conventional wisdom or expectations, and positions your course as a unique and innovative solution to the reader's problem.
